results.idea: Momentum of competitors vs company size
results.description: Combines competitor one-day returns (rel_ret_comp) with company market cap to capture momentum among peers adjusted for size. Applied SUGGESTION1 (used 2 datafields). SUGGESTION2: no vector fields present so not applied. SUGGESTION3: both fields have high coverage (>0.8), no ts_backfill used. SUGGESTION4: used high userCount/alphaCount fields (rel_ret_comp, pv13_revere_index_cap) to exploit robust signals. Confidence set to 0.72 because cross-sectional adjustment by size often improves signal.

Signal: negative of short-run competitor returns z-score to capture mean reversion. SUGGESTION1: used rel_ret_comp and pv13_reveremap to add mapping robustness. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: both coverages high so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: chosen rel_ret_comp for high alphaCount. Confidence 0.65 based on typical weak mean-reversion in competitor averages.

results.idea: High competitor return momentum dampened by many competitors
results.description: Favor firms whose competitors show momentum but where the firm has fewer competitors (rel_num_comp) to concentrate idiosyncratic exposure. SUGGESTION1: used both fields. SUGGESTION2: none. SUGGESTION3: rel_num_comp coverage is high (0.8902) so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: both fields high userCount. Confidence 0.68 due to diversification tradeoff.

Long firms whose customers (rel_ret_cust) are outperforming while competitors lag (rel_ret_comp). SUGGESTION1: used two fields. SUGGESTION2: none. SUGGESTION3: rel_ret_cust coverage 0.4921 <0.6, applied ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,5) to backfill. SUGGESTION4: used rel_ret_comp high counts. Confidence 0.58 acknowledging lower coverage even after backfill.

results.idea: Partner flow momentum adjusted by partner count
results.description: Exploit partner returns (rel_ret_part) scaled by number of partners (rel_num_part) to favor concentrated beneficial partnerships. SUGGESTION1 applied. SUGGESTION2 none. SUGGESTION3 both fields coverage >0.7 so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: rel_num_part has high userCount. Confidence 0.66 reflecting moderate reliability.

Use competitor PageRank (pv13_com_page_rank) to weight recent competitor returns, emphasizing influential competitors. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. SUGGESTION2: page rank is scalar here (no vector) so vec_avg not applied. SUGGESTION3: high coverage so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: pv13_com_page_rank has high userCount. Confidence 0.7 because network centrality often adds signal.

Favor firms with low competitor return volatility (ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp,20)) relative to company cap to reduce unexpected peer shocks. SUGGESTION1 used both fields. SUGGESTION2 none. SUGGESTION3 coverages high so no backfill. SUGGESTION4 used high alphaCount fields. Confidence 0.62 as volatility signals are moderate.

Combine customer return sign (pv13_custretsig_retsig) with competitor momentum to capture directional customer influence. SUGGESTION1 used both fields. SUGGESTION2 none. SUGGESTION3 pv13_custretsig_retsig coverage is high. SUGGESTION4 used high userCount fields. Confidence 0.64 because sign information is noisy but directional.

Long stocks in firms with few primary-sector-focused peers (primary_sector_focused_company_count) showing positive competitor returns. SUGGESTION1 used both fields. SUGGESTION2 none. SUGGESTION3 primary_sector_focused_company_count coverage 0.3508 <0.6, so applied ts_backfill(...,10). SUGGESTION4 balanced by using rel_ret_comp high counts. Confidence 0.52 due to low coverage even after backfill.

Capture firms whose customers' hub scores (pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank) recently rise, indicating centrality in customer network momentum. SUGGESTION1: used hub rank and rel_ret_cust where available. SUGGESTION2: no vectors. SUGGESTION3: both coverages acceptable (>0.7 for hub_rank; rel_ret_cust low -> apply ts_backfill). SUGGESTION4: hub_rank userCount moderate. Confidence 0.55 because customer return coverage low.

Favor firms in sectors with many terminal sectors (pv13_revere_term_sector_total) whose competitors show momentum. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. SUGGESTION2 none. SUGGESTION3 term_sector_total coverage high; no backfill. SUGGESTION4 term_sector_total has high userCount. Confidence 0.6 as structural sector features add robustness.

results.idea: Company index value momentum vs competitors
results.description: Exploit when the specified index (pv13_revere_index_value) is rising relative to competitor returns to capture index-driven flows. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. SUGGESTION2 none. SUGGESTION3 both have full coverage. SUGGESTION4 used high userCount index field. Confidence 0.63 as index dynamics can lead returns.

Adjust competitor mean-reversion signal by mapping strength (pv13_reveremap) to emphasize well-mapped firms. SUGGESTION1 applied. SUGGESTION2 none. SUGGESTION3 high coverage. SUGGESTION4 used rel_ret_comp for robust signal. Confidence 0.61.

Use ts_ir(rel_ret_comp,20) to find firms whose competitors have consistently positive performance relative to volatility. SUGGESTION1 used single main field plus pv13_revere_index_cap to normalize. SUGGESTION2 none. SUGGESTION3 high coverage. SUGGESTION4 rel_ret_comp selected for high alphaCount. Confidence 0.69 reflecting stability of IR measures.

Use ts_kurtosis(rel_ret_comp,30) to detect heavy-tail competitor behavior and avoid firms exposed to erratic peer moves; adjust by market cap. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. SUGGESTION2 none. SUGGESTION3 high coverage. SUGGESTION4 rel_ret_comp chosen for robustness. Confidence 0.56 as kurtosis signals are higher order.

Measure persistence via ts_arg_max(rel_ret_comp,10) = 0 indicates current peak; combine with low competitor count to favor leaders. SUGGESTION1 used ts_arg_max and rel_num_comp. SUGGESTION2 none. SUGGESTION3 coverage high. SUGGESTION4 used rel_num_comp alphaCount high. Confidence 0.61.
